etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Humphry Davy (1778–1829), chemist and inventor. From per- + chloride

definitions: A binary compound of chlorine containing the maximum possible proportion of chlorine.

notes.text: Perchlorides are now named differently; e.g. perchloride of carbon, C₂Cl₆, is hexachloroethane (or perchloroethane); perchloride of iron, Fe₂Cl₆, is iron(iii) chloride, iron trichloride, or ferric chloride.
